author: Qatar Tribune
title: MEC provides designs to develop south of Qatar | Local | News | Qatar Day
text:
THE Logistics Committee of the Ministry of Economic and Commerce (MEC) has announced an initiative to provide designs for the development of areas in south of Qatar.
The maps will provide comprehensive solutions for the construction of various facilities including offices, dry and refrigerated stores for products, showrooms, labour's accommodations and parking.
The move comes within the committee's efforts to help small investors, facilitate the procedures and save time.
The readymade designs and maps feature integrated engineering graphics with all technical details. They will be also accompanied by the necessary permits and approvals from the concerned authorities, which will help save the time of investors.
Two different designs are currently available for two pieces of land spread over an area of 1,000 square metres and 2,000 square metres. Moreover, the typical designs can fit in larger plots as well with some modifications.
 The investors can also modify the designs according to their business needs with approval from the competent authorities, including an approval from the General Administration of Civil Defence (GEDPA) of the Ministry of Interior (MoI).
The initiative will cover South Wakra, Birkat Al Awamer and Aba Salil areas and feature construction of offices, workers' accommodations, showrooms and warehouses.
The areas will also feature construction of assembly units, open storage facilities, refrigerated stores, frozen stores, dry stores, workshops, assembly and processing workshops for light industry, service centres and warehouse facilities.
